because i don't think anyone is actually listening. and the ones who see don't seem to care much. i look on the everyone tab every now and then but rarely see anything i want to see either. i dont see anyone i want to talk to and i dont think anyone sees me as someone they want to talk to either.

@Ekaterina: i guess i dont understand what things are interesting. most things people get excited about here are not interesting to me. i dont really know what to post to excite people so when i DO post i just post what i want, which no one else is interested in.

also in the past i have made numerous attempts to spur conversation and usage of a couple different live chat sites that have been developed on zeronet but none of my efforts really bore lasting fruit. i am not interested in your lecture.
zerome is technologically interesting but i don't actually use twitter or anything that would be described as social media. maybe that is part of the inactivity problem? but that's probably only me.
there are a lot more seeds now, so it loads just fine now. everyone should try again.

I dont really understand how publishing zites works. But if it displays properly from zeronet on your local machine but doesn't display properly from a remote machine, the updates to your site and the new .css may not have spread to everyone in the network yet.

Or else maybe it could be because you're not using a relative link to the .css file. Instead of `<link href="http://127.0.0.1:43110/15xL5zA9TeDxdqwnikSA1SfhFEzMfBxD5D/master.css" rel="stylesheet" >` try doing `<link href="master.css" rel="stylesheet" >`

rest in peace u53r, welcome Chikan!

not sure what you've got cooking, but The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth is on linux I think. and itch.io is definitely the current go to place for little indie games, i don't think there's anywhere better.
[ZeroSites](/Sites.ZeroNetwork.bit/) has a big list of sites you can try to visit.

hubs are where your user data is stored. in theory, it's like picking which email provider you like, or if you are familiar with diaspora it's like picking a pod. i think zerome is just an empty husk of a site until you download the sites for other hubs, since all zerome does is look at the data stored in those hubs and mash them together into the activity timeline.
you don't want to join other hubs, but you will want to download the other hubs by visiting their sites so that zerome can show you posts from hubs other than your own.
you can also like yourself, which is convenient when no one else will!

i've always been one to prefer archives, but most others seem to be the opposite, which is why i actually did make a 0gallery hub. anyway, some people (including myself) don't like to visit 0chan Porn so it's appreciated that you upload some things from it to ZeroUp. my only recommendation would be to use plain old ".zip" to archive instead of gzipped tarballs, which windows and phone users struggle with to open for some reason.

@Chikan: i'm not really comfortable frolicking on zites that host cp.
@Kaffie: me too! i would definitely encourage others to contribute. i'm sure others wouldn't mind more diversity than what i bring to the table.

im quite certain none of the sites you speak of are gone. they were probably just delisted from the site you were seeing them on.
also if cp sites started to get taken down, that would be truly horrifying since the whole point of this software is that sites can't be suddenly taken down

@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: it is understandable if certain content offfends you, however it is also offensive for you to jump onto other people's posts and tag them. especially when no tagging system exists to begin with on this zite. it just comes off as dickheadish.

@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: i don't believe zeronet should have to conform to the regulations laid down by the EU or any other entity. i also don't believe people should enter "wild west" networks without anticipating that they might get offended by something there. in fact, being offended should be considered a feature of zeronet. it means the network is resilient enough from censorship to propogate ideas that you don't agree with.

tl;dr please continue to be offended, that means the network is fully functional. by that same token though, i guess that means you should continue to offend others by "tagging" their posts.
@Ornataweaver: what about child porn?

it feels like there is only the same few people who actually participate or publish anything across all of zeronet. i dont know why zeromedium in particular has such a low amount of activity, but maybe the people who are interested in writing long-form posts prefer to do so on their own blogs.
@Ornataweaver: you can't stop child porn from being distributed
this is some kind of high level shitposting or something

whether or not you are a pedophile is irrelevant to their decision to block you. meanwhile, your decision to distribute CP likely weighed heavily in their decision. it might have been wiser to conduct such an "experiment" using a separate identity, but what you choose to do using your identity is your decision also.
i've never really liked 3d stuff but i'll help seed your posts as long as the content isn't too distasteful or unpleasant.
welcome aboard!

are you using tor-only mode? i have experienced issues in tor-only mode with having poor peerage in the network. i don't really know a solution other than to be incredibly patient and try again later. if you are NOT using tor-only mode, there might be kind of problem with your setup.
@Nasty: on the main page, in the top right corner, does it say something next to "Port:", like closed, open, or error?

if you're able to open the port, you might have an easier time publishing. but sharing the zite address will definitely help, since you'll have more people actively attempting to reach your site and seed it to others.

cool video. he does an amazing job at showing the encounter from the officer's perspective. i clenched when he reached his left arm behind him out of frame.

and yes, an officer could probably lie like that and kill anyone. but this video shows how to prevent a non corrupt officer from accidentally shooting you in a situation where the officer has to make a split second decision based on your uncooperative, possibly threatening behavior.
@leftside: unfortunately the only way to save yourself from a cop who wants to kill you is to shoot first, but that is not really a good option for anyone.

i believe zerohello saves its bookmarks in localstorage, and if that gets wiped when the browser is closed then you will lose bookmarks. i could be wrong about it being localstorage though.
is that the only thing you did there? it seems like a long ways to go for just that.

@Human Bean: on zeronet, the owner of a website you sign and publish content onto has full authoritative control over everything. if you publish something on any site other than one you have the private key to, it can be modified or deleted.

looks like one of those candydoll girls. even if its a drawing, if it is a drawing that represents a specific identifiable child that exists or has existed, then it may still be classified as child pornography, even in jurisdictions which traditionally don't criminalized fictional drawings. but of course this depends entirely on the laws where you live and how they are interpreted and applied. of course it might be a purely fictional drawing not based off of an actual child and i could be mistaken on that.
@Nekololi: of course with that said, the drawing would probably have to be a bit more sexual than this to still qualify as child pornography.
@leftside: so if some people live in china, i shouldn't post democratic free speech because it might send some of them to jail?
@leftside: "some of them will harm kids sexually, BECAUSE OF YOU" That's a very dubious claim. I wonder how you came to this conclusion.

@leftside: "You're triggering people" this isn't some sjw neofeminist hugbox. this is a censorship-resistant peer to peer network where anyone can publish anything. if your feelings are going to be triggered this easily it would do you good to uninstall ZeroNet and return to the "safe zone" you came from.

@leftside: sexual attraction to children is immutable. it cannot be corrected or altered and no diet or magic wand can make it go away. you cannot make someone who is attracted to children stop being attracted to children.

@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: not me, i'll click on pretty much anything. the less i know about it the more likely it is i'll click it. so far nothing bad's happened to me.
it's likely because you are using the tor browser, which has access to the "canvas" disabled by default, and zerome utilizes the canvas to capture image files to publish it.
@Eightyfour: i don't really know if you can reenable it in the tor browser. you'd have to google it.
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: it's a good thing i set an alt text for it
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: oh. the html file updated for me but it didn't change the name of fbi.jpg in the data folder for some reason.

"Remember that at any time someone might link or href to their own HTTP server to get your IP address. You might be interested in blocking the browser from accessing the clearnet or blocking third party resources to prevent this."

i seriously considered hrefing the real fbi.gov, but i figured a whopping total of myself and maybe one other person would even notice that their browser was attempting to make the request to its server...
@Thunder: using a dedicated browser (such as a "ZeroNet browser" would solve this issue as @styromaniac@zeroid.bit: said, but in the meantime I encourage everyone to learn how to use uMatrix.

harrassment isn't free speech. following someone around or going to their funeral to tell them their loved one should go to hell is not free speech. it is harrassment. you are permitted to say they are going to hell, but lurking around their funeral or following the family around is different from exercising free speech.

yes it is. they make for good company i think.

the white image is because zerome needs access to the canvas element to load up images, and tor browser has the canvas element disabled because used in certain ways it can be used to fingerprint users
@Realjohndoe: i2p would not prevent fingerprinting from the canvas element... it is a browser problem not a problem with the network traffic is being sent through...
and because supporting only one certificate authority is basically helping centralize zeronet

i get that you're trying to shock people, but please refrain from posting things like this without suitable warning of what it is. possessing or uploading (aka: seeding) images such as this have significant consequences in most places in the world.

@Colkurtz: users who view the file download it. and by virtue of having an optional file downlaoded through zeronet, they are helping seed (distribute!) it, which is almost certainly a legal liability in most places in the world.
is it particularly wise to keep your cryptocoin wallet in your web browser - the #1 thing on your computer that every bad guy is trying to compromise?
@Piloth: i would strongly encourage my gran to transfer those coins she mines to a wallet that isn't embedded in her browser

if the site worked as advertised (muting/blacklisting a problematic user causing all of their images and posts to be deleted from my filesystem) it would not be as bad. i don't really care whether this feature doesn't work due to millchan's code or due to flaws in zeronet's code. the site claims it works, but it doesn't. i have to manually go into millchan's user data folders and find the content myself and manually delete it.
@Realjohndoe: i don't think it's possible for styromaniac to censor millchan unless he gets some people's private keys.
@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: i may try testing millchan again to see if the blacklist/deletion features worked as intended. i only know that when i originally tested it, they did not.
@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: looks like it works. that was really high up on my concerns about using the site, so i'm glad this issue did eventually get resolved.
